title: The present ages of A and B are in the ratio 4:5 and after 5 years they will be in the ratio 5:6. What is the present age of A? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let x be the age of A and y be the age of B Hence x/y = 4/5. ………….. (1) After 5 years (x+5)/(y+5) = 5/6 Or 6x + 30 = 5y + 25 ……….. (2) From (1), we have x = ( 4/5)*y . Putting this in (2), we have 6* (4/5)y + 30 = 5 y + 25 (24/5)y - 5y = -5 (24y - 25y)/5 = -5 -y = -25 y = 25 , x = 4/5y = (4/5)*25 = 20 Therefore x = 20 and y = 25 . That means the present age of A is 20 and B is 25

Let the present age of ‘A’ and ‘B’ be =4x : 5xAfter 5- years their ages will be in the ratio (4x+5) : (5x+5) = 5 : 6.Upon cross- multiplying and solving we get 24 x+ 30 = 25x +25.= x= 5.So the Present age of A= 25Present age of B= 30.
